intro: Uragoga ivorensis var. puberula, commonly known as the Ivorian uragoga, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, pubescent stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland areas. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
